entry.title: Rust Meetup #10
entry.content:
Rust Basel Meetup #10 â€“ Talks, Snacks, and Community Vibes

On March 18th, we hit a nice round number: Rust Basel Meetup #10 ğŸ‰ Thanks to our generous hosts at MDPI, we gathered once again at Grosspeteranlage 5 to share knowledge, laughter, and stories from the Rust trenches.

This time, we were treated to two insightful talks from community membersâ€”and the promise of a third, TBD-style!

ğŸ¤ The Talks

  • Yasin GÃ¼ndÃ¼z opened the evening with a philosophical yet practical dive into "How to inject Rust into people's hearts, minds, and production code." His journey touched on more than just syntaxâ€”it was about winning hearts (and org charts) with Rust's strengths.

  • Michael Kefeder followed with "Anecdotal evidence that Rust is not hard to learn or slowing down development." What started as a personal take on learning Rust quickly turned into a broader discussion about the languageâ€™s ecosystem. From package management to dev tooling to onboarding juniors, this talk lit a spark that carried into many conversations throughout the evening.

  • The open slot remained just thatâ€”open. If youâ€™ve got a Rust story, experiment, or lesson learned, weâ€™d love to hear it at a future meetup. Ping us on Discord!

ğŸ§ƒ Community + Snacks

As always, the conversations flowed long after the talks ended. With drinks in hand and pizza on plates (thanks again to E+H Digital Solutions for sponsoring the food ğŸ™Œ), we huddled around laptops, shared projects, debated error handling strategies, and dove into Rust's evolving ecosystem.

We also welcomed a few new facesâ€”some folks brand-new to Rust, and others already deep into it. Whether you're writing your first main() or refactoring a codebase in safe concurrency, Rust Basel is for everyone.

ğŸ—ºï¸ Logistics Recap

The meetup was hosted at MDPI, just a 10-minute walk from Basel SBB. Pro tip for next time: the elevator is small but mighty. And don't forget to ring at MDPI on the doorbell screen.

ğŸ§¡ Thank You!

  • MDPI â€“ for the lovely venue.
  • E+H Digital Solutions â€“ for keeping us fed.
  • Everyone who attended â€“ for being part of this growing Rust community in Basel!

â• Stay in Touch

  • Join us on Discord
  • Check out upcoming events and blog posts at rust-basel.ch
  • Or just drop by the next meetup and say hi!

Looking forward to seeing you at Rust Basel #11 ğŸ‘‹

Till then: cargo install rust_basel_energy
